page.title: 06A typical Farm (continued)
page.content: During the Winter months we house the {dairy herd}in a Cubicle shed where we have centre feeding facilities.They are fed a mixture of silage and Barley nutrients.The cows are milked in a Herring-bone parlour enabling twelve cows in at one time. {Our crops}are stored in various places around the farm.Silage is stored in an outside clamp supported by sleepers slotted into girders.Straw and Hay is kept under two Dutch barns,Grain is stored on the loft floors and a grain bin in one of the large sheds.Potatoes are mainly sold of the fields but are sometimes stored in the large shed where they can be protected from the Frost by covering with bales of Straw. My work force comprises of myself,my wife,a full-time worker and my two sons,when they are not at school.
